intro: Psychotria divaricata, commonly known as the "Crimson Beauty," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers, which are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria divaricata is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of alkaloids.
